intro: Chenopodium cyanifolium, commonly known as blueleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its blue-green leaves, which are covered in fine hairs, and its small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Chenopodium cyanifolium is adapted to arid environments and is capable of surviving with minimal water.
